channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: How I Got the Full Right-Click Menu back in Windows 11
item.dc:creator: Rich Hein
item.description: I was fed up with Windows 11’s shortened right-click menu. Here’s how I restored the full classic menu in just a few steps.
item.content:encoded: With Windows 10 end of support rapidly approaching, I’ve been upgrading several PCs to Windows 11. One thing that I always find frustrating is the new abbreviated context menus. Part of the problem is that I’ve used the classic Windows context menu for a long time, and I’m very comfortable with it. But what really irritates me is regularly needing to click “Show more options,” to drill down to things like 7Zip and other menu items that get hidden.

item.title: The iPhone 17 Pro Bulks Up On Features and Is Better For It
item.dc:creator: Tyler Hayes
item.description: Excellent battery life, better cameras, and a bold new color.
item.content:encoded: There's little ambiguity about the Apple iPhone 17 Pro this year. It gets a little bigger and heavier to make a show of putting function over form and separating itself from the iPhone Air. As such, there wasn't one specific feature— beit a 48MP telephoto lens, or extreme battery life—that makes this phone a Pro.

item.title: How to Fix Your USB Drive Not Showing Up on Windows 10 or Windows 11
item.dc:creator: Chris Hoffman
Nick Lewis
item.description: Sometimes when you plug a USB drive into your PC it doesn't show up. We're going to look at a few ways to fix that problem.
item.content:encoded: USB drives should automatically appear in File Explorer when you connect them to your computer. Follow these troubleshooting steps if your Windows 10 or Windows 11 PC doesn't show a connected drive.

item.title: Learning the Windows Command Line? Here's Where to Start
item.dc:creator: Chifundo Kasiya
item.description: Your journey to master the Command Line starts here!
item.content:encoded: Although it's typical to interact with the graphical user interface when using Windows, it's still a good idea to know how to use the Command Line. If you dedicate the time to learning it, you could uncover a tool that can enhance your productivity, give you deeper control of Windows, and help you troubleshoot system issues without clicking too many things. You just need to know how to get started using it.

item.title: 6 Hidden Firefox Settings for Better Privacy and Fewer Distractions
item.dc:creator: Shan Abdul
item.content:encoded: Firefox comes with a range of features you might never use—and may even find annoying. While some nuisances can be turned off in the regular settings menu, others require adjustments on the about:config page—and that approach is often quicker too. Here are a few settings I’ve turned off using it.

item.title: Linux Apps on Android Are One Step Closer to Reality
item.dc:creator: Arol Wright
item.content:encoded: The Linux subsystem on Android is capable of opening up a huge range of possibilities. And the vast majority of them can be unlocked once this tiny, but important, change actually makes it to stable Android.

item.title: Don't Ignore Your TV's Sharpness Setting
item.dc:creator: Sydney Butler
item.description: Is your TV's sharpness setting ruining your favorite shows?
item.content:encoded: There are so many different settings on your TV, it's hard to know which ones matter and which have a real effect on your viewing experience. Most are pretty self-explanatory, or you can just mess with the ones that aren't and tell what they do by eye.

item.title: C7 Corvette Buying Guide: Snag a Supercar Bargain
item.dc:creator: Tyler Dupont
item.description: Get insider tips to buy a C7 Corvette that delivers supercar thrills without the sky-high price.
item.content:encoded: The C7 generation of America’s sports car offers supercar performance without the six-figure price tag, making it one of the best bargains on the used market. With sharp handling, a thundering V-8, and unmistakable styling, it delivers an exotic driving experience at a fraction of the cost of European rivals. For enthusiasts seeking maximum thrills per dollar, it’s hard to beat.

item.title: Why Your First Smart Home Purchase Is the Most Important
item.dc:creator: Tim Brookes
item.content:encoded: Building a smart home is easier than ever, but building a smart home that meets your expectations is a little trickier. Much of the time, your smart home’s trajectory is determined by the very first purchases you make.

item.title: How to Take Long Exposure Photos on a Samsung Galaxy Phone
item.dc:creator: Joe Fedewa
item.description: You can take long exposure photos with your Samsung phone.
item.content:encoded: Long-exposure photos always look super impressive. You might wonder what kind of high-tech camera was used to do it. Well, you don't need a fancy camera—you can take long-exposure photos with your Samsung Galaxy phone.
